Package org.joaobarrera.controller

Class WorkoutApiController

java.lang.Object
org.joaobarrera.controller.WorkoutApiController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/workout") public class WorkoutApiController extends Object
The WorkoutApiController class provides REST API endpoints for managing workout data within the Workout Logger application.

It handles CRUD operations and database interactions such as creating, updating, deleting, and retrieving workout entries.

It also supports unit conversion (kilometers to miles and vice versa) and database connection management, enabling smooth interaction between the frontend interface and backend logic.

  • Constructor Details

    • WorkoutApiController

      public WorkoutApiController(WorkoutManager workoutManager)
      Constructor that initializes the WorkoutApiController with a WorkoutManager instance.

      The WorkoutManager is used to perform all business logic and database operations related to workout-data management.

      Parameters:
      workoutManager - the service layer object responsible for handling workout logic

  • Method Details

    • getAllWorkouts

      @GetMapping("/getAll") public List<Workout> getAllWorkouts()
      Retrieves all workout records stored in the database.

      If the operation is unsuccessful, null is returned.

      Returns:
      a list of all stored workouts or null if the operation fails

    • getWorkoutByName

      @GetMapping("/getByName") public List<Workout> getWorkoutByName(@RequestParam("name") String name)
      Retrieves all workouts that match the provided name or partial name.

      If no records are found, it returns an empty list.

      If the operation fails, null is returned.

      Parameters:
      name - the workout name or partial name used for searching
      Returns:
      a list of matching workout records, or null for error

    • createWorkout

      @PostMapping("/create") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> createWorkout(@RequestBody Workout workout)
      Creates a new workout record using the data provided in the request body.

      Returns an HTTP response indicating success or failure.

      Failures will contain a JSON Response with an error message.

      Parameters:
      workout - the workout object containing the new workout's details
      Returns:
      HTTP response describing the result of the creation attempt

    • updateWorkout

      @PutMapping("/updateByID") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateWorkout(@RequestBody Workout workout)
      Updates an existing workout based on the ID provided inside the workout object.

      Returns an HTTP response describing the success or failure of the update.

      Failures will contain a JSON Response with an error message.

      Parameters:
      workout - the updated workout information, including the existing ID
      Returns:
      HTTP response describing the result of the update attempt

    • deleteWorkout

      @DeleteMapping("/deleteByID") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteWorkout(@RequestBody Workout workout)
      Deletes a workout from the database using the ID provided in the request body.

      Returns an HTTP response indicating whether the deletion was successful.

      Failures will contain a JSON Response with an error message.

      Parameters:
      workout - the workout object containing the ID of the workout to delete
      Returns:
      HTTP response describing the result of the deletion attempt

    • convertAllUnits

      @PutMapping("/convertUnits") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> convertAllUnits(@RequestBody UnitType unitType)
      Converts the unit of measurement for all workouts to the specified type (kilometers or miles).

      Returns an HTTP response indicating success or failure.

      Failures will contain a JSON Response with an error message.

      Parameters:
      unitType - the unit type that all existing workouts should be converted to
      Returns:
      HTTP response describing the result of the conversion
